title: Codegen Meta-Schema
description: Extensions for language-agnostic code generation from JSON Schema. These x-familiar-* properties can be added to any schema to control how it is represented in generated code (Rust, TypeScript, Python).

x-familiar-enum-repr.description: How to serialize union variants. Required for oneOf schemas.

x-familiar-discriminator.description: Field name used to distinguish variants (e.g., 'type', 'command_type', 'kind'). Required for internally_tagged and adjacently_tagged enums.

x-familiar-content.description: Field name for content in adjacently_tagged enums (e.g., 'data', 'value'). Only used with adjacently_tagged repr.

x-familiar-casing.description: Naming convention for fields and variant values in serialized output.

x-familiar-variants.description: Map of JSON serialized value to code identifier name. Keys are the snake_case values in JSON, values are PascalCase identifiers in code.

x-familiar-flatten.description: Flatten nested struct fields into parent. Maps to #[serde(flatten)] in Rust, intersection types in TypeScript.

x-familiar-skip-none.description: Omit null/None fields when serializing. Maps to #[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")] in Rust.

x-familiar-newtype.description: Wrap primitive in a semantic newtype wrapper. Creates a distinct type rather than a type alias.

x-familiar-default.description: Use Default::default() for missing fields. Maps to #[serde(default)] in Rust.
